pages.text: These basic wooden charms are still used by villagers, and are easy enough to carve if you have a template. Charms must be worn around the neck to have any effect. Wooden charms are also the only runes comfortable enough to wear this way.$(br)$(br)Their effects seem to scale with the strength of the wearer - as most scientists are... less than robust, this has made it difficult for my more sedentary colleagues to verify their effects.
$(l)Warrior Charm$()$(br)$(br)The warrior charm is said to enhance vitality and strength. It's been used by many famous (and several less successful) warriors throughout history.

$(l)Luck Charm$()$(br)$(br)A charm favored by thieves and tomb raiders, even today. Through some mysterious means, it does seem to improve one's findings - I wore one during my most successful expeditions!

$(l)Health Charm$()$(br)$(br)A charm given to the ill. Said to improve recovery time, slowly purging the body of all impurities. Not only have I confirmed this, the charm is also surprisingly effective against curses. Wearing one almost feels like slowly sipping on a cubic meter of milk.
